[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/metrics.rs] [Metrics: CONNECTED_INSTANCES] [Network topology disclosure] Can CONNECTED_INSTANCES expose internal network topology and service architecture to external attackers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/metrics.rs] [Metrics: CACHE_START_VERSION, CACHE_END_VERSION] [Non-atomic updates] Are CACHE_START_VERSION and CACHE_END_VERSION updated atomically, or can race conditions cause observers to see inconsistent cache ranges? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/metrics.rs] [Metrics: FILE_STORE_VERSION, FILE_STORE_VERSION_IN_CACHE] [Cache invalidation race] Can race conditions between updating FILE_STORE_VERSION and FILE_STORE_VERSION_IN_CACHE cause cache coherency issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/metrics.rs] [Metrics: IS_MASTER, FILE_STORE_VERSION] [Master transition race] During master election transitions, can the new master start uploading at an incorrect FILE_STORE_VERSION, causing gaps or overwrites? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/metrics.rs] [Metrics: TIMER] [Histogram bucket explosion] Can the exponential_buckets configuration (factor=2.0, count=30) cause excessive memory usage when tracking very long operations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/metrics.rs] [Metrics: COUNTER, TIMER] [Unbounded labels] Can the generic COUNTER and TIMER metrics accept unbounded label values, causing memory exhaustion through high-cardinality metrics? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/metrics.rs] [Metrics: ALL] [Panic on registration failure] Will metric registration failures cause panics via .unwrap(), crashing the indexer-grpc-manager on startup? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/metrics.rs] [Metrics: ALL] [Silent failure risk] If the Prometheus registry is full or corrupted, will metric updates silently fail, hiding service degradation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/metrics.rs] [Metrics: ALL] [Scrape endpoint DoS] Can attackers overwhelm the Prometheus scrape endpoint by triggering excessive metric updates, causing monitoring system failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/metrics.rs] [Metrics: IS_FILE_STORE_LAGGING, IS_MASTER] [Alert fatigue] Can rapid oscillation of boolean metrics (IS_MASTER, IS_FILE_STORE_LAGGING) between 0 and 1 cause alert fatigue and mask real incidents? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/metrics.rs] [Metrics: CACHE_END_VERSION] [Off-by-one errors] The comment says CACHE_END_VERSION is 'exclusive' - can confusion about inclusive vs exclusive semantics cause cache boundary errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/metrics.rs] [Metrics: FILE_STORE_VERSION] [Version interpretation] Is FILE_STORE_VERSION the 'next_version' to be written or the last completed version? Can ambiguity cause synchronization errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/metrics.rs] [Metrics: ALL] [Metric name changes] If metric names are changed (e.g., aptos_indexer_grpc_v2_* â†’ v3_*), will existing dashboards and alerts break, causing monitoring blind spots? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/metrics.rs] [Metrics: ALL] [Metric deprecation] If metrics are removed in future versions, will dependent monitoring infrastructure fail gracefully or crash? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/metrics.rs] [Metrics: FILE_STORE_VERSION] [Version skew] Can version skew between the indexer-grpc-manager's FILE_STORE_VERSION and the actual fullnode version cause data corruption or missed transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/metrics.rs] [Metrics: CONNECTED_INSTANCES] [Service health correlation] Can incorrect CONNECTED_INSTANCES counts mask backend service failures, allowing degraded service to continue undetected? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/metrics.rs] [Metrics: FILE_STORE_UPLOADED_BYTES] [Disk space exhaustion] Can FILE_STORE_UPLOADED_BYTES be used to predict disk space exhaustion, or will file store operations continue until failure? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/metrics.rs] [Metrics: CACHE_SIZE] [Memory leak detection] Can CACHE_SIZE being persistently near MAX_CACHE_SIZE indicate a memory leak that will eventually cause crashes? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-manager/src/metrics.rs] [Metrics: TIMER] [Timing attack amplification] Can the TIMER histogram's high-resolution timing (1e-6 seconds = 1 microsecond) enable timing side-channel attacks against the indexer? (Low)
